Class CompressedBytes

java.lang.Object
com.dua3.utility.data.CompressedBytes
public final class CompressedBytes extends Object
The CompressedBytes class provides functionality to compress and decompress byte arrays or input streams using the Deflate compression algorithm. Instances of this class store the compressed data and offer an interface to retrieve the decompressed data through an InputStream.

This class is intended to be used when relatively large amounts of binary data have to be kept in memory but are not frequently needed to be uncompressed.

The compressed data is stored in an internal byte array inflated on demand. If the deflated data need more space than the original data, the data is stored uncompressed. The first byte of the internal array is set to 0 if the data is stored uncompressed, 1 otherwise.

  • Method Details

    • compress

      public static CompressedBytes compress(byte[] data)
      Compresses the given byte array using the Deflate compression algorithm.
      Parameters:
      data - the byte array to be compressed
      Returns:
      a CompressedBytes instance containing the compressed data

    • compress

      public static CompressedBytes compress(InputStream data)
      Compresses the data from the given InputStream using the Deflate compression algorithm and returns a CompressedBytes instance containing the compressed data.
      Parameters:
      data - the InputStream containing the data to be compressed
      Returns:
      a CompressedBytes instance that contains the compressed data

    • loadCompressedData

      public static CompressedBytes loadCompressedData(InputStream in) throws IOException
      Loads compressed data from the given InputStream and returns a CompressedBytes instance.
      Parameters:
      in - the InputStream containing the compressed data to be loaded
      Returns:
      a CompressedBytes instance representing the loaded compressed data
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading from the InputStream

    • loadCompressedData

      public static CompressedBytes loadCompressedData(byte[] data)
      Loads a compressed representation of the given byte array and wraps it in a CompressedBytes instance.
      Parameters:
      data - the byte array containing the compressed data
      Returns:
      a CompressedBytes instance wrapping the given compressed data
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the input data is empty

    • isCompressed

      public boolean isCompressed()
      Determines if the data held in this instance is in a compressed state.
      Returns:
      true if the data is compressed, otherwise false.

    • inputStream

      public InputStream inputStream()
      Provides an InputStream that decompresses the internal byte array using the Inflate algorithm.
      Returns:
      an InputStream that allows reading the original data

    • toByteArray

      public byte[] toByteArray()
      Converts the compressed data stored in this instance into a byte array by decompressing it.

      Note that this method must always create a new byte array to return the data, even if the data is uncompressed. In general, it is better to use inputStream() as it needs less memory when working on large data.

      Returns:
      a byte array representing the decompressed data
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the decompressed data

    • getCompressedData

      public byte[] getCompressedData()
      Returns the internal compressed data as a byte array.
      Returns:
      a byte array containing the compressed data
